meanings.definition: Damage the good reputation of (someone); slander or libel.
meanings.sent1: She was defaming her classmate by spreading false rumors about her.
meanings.sent2: The journalist was accused of defaming a public figure in his article.
meanings.sent3: The gossiping parrot in the pet store was defaming the other birds.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the wall was defaming the beauty of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The online trolls were defaming the reputation of the company with their negative comments.

meanings.definition: The action of damaging the good reputation of someone; slander or libel.
meanings.sent1: Defaming can have serious consequences on a person's life and career.
meanings.sent2: The lawsuit was filed against the tabloid for engaging in defaming of celebrities.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show exaggerated the concept of defaming for laughs.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of doubt cast by defaming can be hard to erase.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the destructive power of defaming in a dramatic scene.
